band_description: Processes mostly ad hoc or tribal; documentation missing or outdated; strong reliance on individuals; high variance in outcomes.
Key processes identified and documented; staff generally aware but adherence is inconsistent; firefighting still frequent.
Processes are consistently followed and measured; roles clear; improvement initiatives underway.
Operations are stable, automated where appropriate, and continuously improved; SLAs monitored and reliably met.
Customer interactions unmanaged; no systematic tracking of satisfaction, complaints, or response times.
Basic metrics (e.g., response time) tracked; some standards exist; customer experience varies by team or channel.
CX metrics (e.g., CSAT/NPS) defined and regularly reviewed; feedback informs changes; service is consistent.
Customer experience is a strategic focus; consistently strong scores; proactive outreach and improvement.
Decision rights unclear; minimal policy framework; risks are known informally but not tracked.
Core roles and decision rights documented; some policies exist; risk management is emerging but incomplete.
Governance structure and key policies are in place and used; risk register maintained; change is controlled.
Governance is integrated into daily practice; regular reviews; risk and compliance are actively managed.
Data is siloed and manually collected; reports are infrequent; trust in numbers is low.
Key reports exist and are produced regularly; some manual work and data quality issues remain.
Dashboards cover core KPIs; data quality good enough for most decisions; basic integrations in place.
High-quality, near real-time data; integrated views; advanced analytics and insights drive decisions.
Revenue model unclear or unproven; inconsistent cash flow; scaling breaks existing operations.
Main revenue streams identified; basic unit economics understood; some pricing and offer clarity.
Strong grip on unit economics and margins; clear growth levers; scaling plans tested and feasible.
Scalable business model with proven growth; multiple levers; operations and governance support further scaling.
